item.title: Python post
item.description: ## In python we were able to create a function that can scan dna stands to find how many times each three ltter base code shows up in the sequence and tell you import re my_seq1 = "ATCATCATG" my_seq2 = "CAGCCCAATCAGGCTCTACTGCCACTAAACTTACGCAGGATATATTTACGCCGACGTACT" # Your code goes here def count_mers(my_seq1): mers=re.findall(r'[ATGC][ATGC][ATGC]',my_seq1) counts={} for c in mers: if c in counts: counts[c]+=1 else: counts[c]=1 for c in counts: print(c, "appears", counts[c],"times") count_mers(my_seq1) ## ATC appears 2 times ## ATG appears 1 times count_mers(my_seq2) ## CAG appears 2 times ## CCC appears 1 times ## AAT appears 1 times ## GCT appears 1 times ## CTA appears 2 times ## CTG appears 1 times ## CCA appears 1 times ## AAC appears 1 times ## TTA appears 2 times ## CGC appears 2 times ## AGG appears 1 times ## ATA appears 1 times ## TAT appears 1 times ## CGA appears 1 times ## CGT appears 1 times ## ACT appears 1 times

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
